alert.note: Alert for Inland Volusia; Seminole (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 26 at 4:29PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Seminole and south central Volusia Counties through 500 PM EDT... At 429 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Lake Jessup, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Deltona, Sanford, Oviedo, Winter Springs and Lake Mary. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. These types of funnel clouds are harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for east central Florida.
